entities.name: HUMAN BODY
entities.description: The human body is a complex system with various defense mechanisms to protect against harmful pathogens

entities.name: PATHOGENS
entities.description: Pathogens include bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites that can cause infections in the human body

entities.name: IMMUNE SYSTEM
entities.description: The immune system is a network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to fight off infections and restore health

entities.name: SKIN
entities.description: The skin acts as a physical barrier that prevents pathogens from entering the deeper tissues of the body

entities.name: MUCOUS MEMBRANES
entities.description: Mucous membranes in the respiratory and digestive tracts produce mucus that traps pathogens and prevents them from entering the body

entities.name: STOMACH
entities.description: The acidic environment of the stomach can kill many pathogens before they cause an infection

entities.name: WHITE BLOOD CELLS
entities.description: White blood cells, including neutrophils, macrophages, and lymphocytes, are key players in the immune response, responsible for detecting and destroying pathogens

entities.name: NEUTROPHILS
entities.description: Neutrophils are the most abundant type of white blood cells and are the first responders to an infection, engulfing and destroying pathogens through phagocytosis

entities.name: MACROPHAGES
entities.description: Macrophages are white blood cells that patrol the body, engulfing and destroying pathogens, and alerting other immune cells to the presence of an infection

entities.name: LYMPHOCYTES
entities.description: Lymphocytes are white blood cells responsible for mounting a more targeted and specific immune response, including B cells and T cells

entities.name: B CELLS
entities.description: B cells are a type of lymphocyte that produce antibodies to bind to pathogens and mark them for destruction

entities.name: T CELLS
entities.description: T cells are a type of lymphocyte that directly attack infected cells

entities.name: DENDRITIC CELLS
entities.description: Dendritic cells capture and present antigens to T cells, initiating a more specific immune response

entities.name: NATURAL KILLER CELLS
entities.description: Natural killer cells are immune cells that can directly kill infected cells

entities.name: COMPLEMENT PROTEINS
entities.description: Complement proteins enhance the ability of antibodies to destroy pathogens

entities.name: CYTOKINES
entities.description: Cytokines are signaling molecules that coordinate the immune response and regulate the activity of immune cells

entities.name: IMMUNOLOGICAL MEMORY
entities.description: Immunological memory is the ability of the immune system to remember past infections and mount a faster and more effective response upon re-exposure to the same pathogen

entities.name: AUTOIMMUNE DISEASES
entities.description: Autoimmune diseases occur when the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own tissues, leading to conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, and multiple sclerosis

entities.name: CHRONIC INFLAMMATION
entities.description:
Chronic inflammation can result from a dysregulated immune response and contribute to the development of various conditions
Chronic inflammation can contribute to the development of conditions such as heart disease, diabetes, and cancer
